Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Haggis \Hag"gis\ (-g[i^]s), n. [Scot. hag to hack, chop, E. hack. Formed, perhaps, in imitation of the F. hachis (E. hash), fr. hacher.] A Scotch pudding made of the heart, liver, lights, etc., of a sheep or lamb, minced with suet, onions, oatmeal, etc., highly seasoned, and boiled in the stomach of the same animal; minced head and pluck. [Written also {haggiss}, {haggess}, and {haggies}.] [1913 Webster]
haggis n : made of sheep's or calf's viscera minced with oatmeal and suet and onions and boiled in the animal's stomach
